metadata.title: CVE-2022-21166 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete cleanup in specific special register write operations for someIntel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1145-azure - 4.15.0-1145.160~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: intel-microcode: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'early microcode loading not allowed').
linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-190.241').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.115').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1145.160~14.04.1').
